SAVING LIVES | Burnley Football Club has teamed up with North West Ambulance Service (NWAS) to show match goers how easy it is to save the life of someone in cardiac arrest.
Cardiac arrest is the most extreme emergency and happens when the heart stops pumping blood around the body. If someone has a cardiac arrest, they will lose consciousness almost at once and there are no other signs of life.

MAGIC MOMENTS | A look back at the 1962 FA Cup semi-final, where Burnley met Sunday's opponents, Fulham.
The Clarets went into a replay with it all still to play for after a 1-1 draw in the first meeting at Villa Park.
But with two goals from Jimmy Robson and an assist from the late, great Jimmy McIlroy, the Clarets won 2-1 at Filbert Street and went on to face Tottenham Hotspur in the final at Wembley.

INJURY UPDATE | Nick Pope has undergone successful surgery on the shoulder injury he suffered in the Clarets‚Äô European opener against Aberdeen.
Pope dislocated a shoulder early in the 1-1 draw at Pittodrie in last Thursday night‚Äôs Europa League second-round qualifier first leg.
No timescale has been put on a possible return to action for the England international goalkeeper.

ANNIVERSARY VICTORY | BURNLEY 1 - NEWCASTLE 0
Sean Dyche was able to celebrate his fifth anniversary as Burnley manager in fitting style as Jeff Hendrick‚Äôs second-half winner propelled the Clarets back up the Premier League.
When Dyche took over in October, 2012, Burnley were languishing in 14th-place in the Championship.
Now, thanks to Hendrick‚Äôs second goal of the season and Dyche‚Äôs enduring qualities the Clarets sit seventh in the top flight.

TESTING DAY | The Barry Kilby Prostate Cancer Appeal is set to host another prostate cancer testing day at Turf Moor.
On Saturday, September 30, between 10am and 1pm, prostate-specific antigen (PSA) tests will be available for men over 50, or 45 if cancer is prevalent in their family, at a subsidised cost of just ¬£5.
This follows two previous sessions. which have detected the early stages of prostate cancer in men ‚Äì and saved lives!

text:
Lancashire Police Statement:
Lancashire Police
August 5, 2017 at 5:30 PM ¬∑
Chief Superintendent Chris Bithell, of Lancashire Police, said: ‚ÄúA decision has been taken to abandon the football match between Burnley FC and Hanover 96, following consultation between the police match commander, the referee and Burnley FC‚Äôs grounds safety officer.
‚ÄúThis follows violent behaviour by a group of travelling Hanover fans, who attempted to attack fans in the home stands, as well as police officers and stewards.
‚ÄúAlthough a robust policing operation was in place for the match, based on pre-game intelligence, additional resources have now been brought in from across the county to ensure no further disorder occurs.‚Äù

FINAL SCORE | Burnley 0 - Man Utd 2
The Clarets were unable to halt Manchester United‚Äôs relentless Premier League run as first-half goals from Anthony Martial and Wayne Rooney gave the former champions the points at Turf Moor.
Jose Mourinho‚Äôs side hasn‚Äôt lost a league fixture since October and are now unbeaten in 23 games ‚Äì the best mid-season run in the competition since United themselves went undefeated for 24 games in 2010/11.

FIXTURES | Two of Burnley's fixtures in April have been moved for live television broadcast.
The Clarets trip to Crystal Palace on Saturday, 29 April will now kick-off at 5.30pm and be shown live on BT Sport.
And Manchester United's visit to Turf Moor has been moved back a day to Sunday, 23 April, kick-off 2.15pm, for live screening on Sky Sports.
The fixture change against United is dependent, however, on the EFL Cup winners not reaching the semi-finals of the FA Cup, which are scheduled for that weekend.
United are away to Chelsea in the quarter-finals.

A massive well done to the Burnley FC staff, supported by Dafabet UK, and everyone who participated in the Burnley and Pendle FUNDRUN 2016 this morning.
A fantastic event which saw hundreds of runners take to the 5K course around Towneley Park, all in the name of CARES charity, aiming to increase cancer survival rates through support screening and early reporting.
A massive well done and thank you to everyone involved.
#bfc #cares #5kfundrun
